lexUnit.name: book.n

document.description: Examples of the lemma bookn from the MASC project for FN annotation
document.name: bookn

lexUnit.definition: FN: the records of the accounts of a business (usually plural); any other binded pages which contain recorded data

sentence.text: BELLAMY : Off the books , of course .
He opened one and saw it was a form of ledger , an accounts book for St Peter 's .
Only a sophisticated handful of collectors seek company minute books , ledgers and subject files to add historical depth to displayable hardware such as insurance firemarks or automobilia .

Thus the lack of balance which strikes anyone looking at a thoroughly drained , treeless landscape is reflected in a lack of honest balancing in the books and ledgers which lie behind that landscape .
Also of great interest are the ledgers and account books which give details of production costs , actors ' and technicians ' salaries , box-office takings and general running costs .
Whenever he buried himself in the ledgers and account books , he lost all sense of time .
Take all your books and pay the necessary amounts into them , at intervals .

Er and at the end of the quarter I could n't pay that , then obviously you got no dividend on it because you still owed them that hundred pounds , but they would take the book away so you could n't get any more .
Because the misconduct and cooked books have , at least in part , been driven by stockholders ' demand for value and high returns regardless of the truth .
At least we know the airlines are n't cooking the books like some in corporate America .
" We did not , I believe , encounter a setting where Arthur Andersen did something to allow us to cook the books , or to misstate earnings , or something of that nature , " he said .
Understand , we ought to go after every executive and accountant who broke the law or cooked the books or got rich off of options as his company tanked .

" It 's clear that in the telecom sector where you 've had some real problems with overcapacity , some real problems in the business , it appears that some of these cost-cutting efforts and cooking the books occurred to basically hide what was a failing business practice , " Michael G . Oxley , R-O hio and chairman of the Financial Services Committee , said Sunday on " Fox News Sunday . "
The options - - rights to buy stock at a fixed price after the market price has risen - - gave these executives an incentive to cook the books to keep the market price high .
They have influenced accountants to cook the books and make profits appear where losses inhabit .
" My administration will do everything in our power to end the days of cooking the books , shading the truth and breaking our laws , " Bush said .

Appearing on " Fox News Sunday , " House Financial Services Chairman Michael Oxley , R-O hio , said he believes Monday 's hearing is likely to reveal that WorldCom executives were " cooking the books . . .
